remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TableHeaderRow> class represents a heading row in a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Table> control. This class supports displaying tables on devices with a limited screen size. On these devices, a table with many columns and rows must be rendered across multiple pages. Adding a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TableHeaderRow> to a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Table> control allows you to specify a heading row that is rendered as the first row on each page that displays a view of the table. For more information about the view formats for a table rendered on a device with a limited screen size, see <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Table>.
A <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TableHeaderRow> object can contain only <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TableCell> objects. To add content to the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TableHeaderRow>, you must add one or more <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TableCell> objects to the row. Then, set the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TableCell.Text%2A> property of each <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TableCell> object in the row to specify the contents of each cell. Alternatively, you can add a control to a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TableCell> object to specify its contents.
You can programmatically manage the cells in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TableHeaderRow> by using the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TableRow.Cells%2A> collection. The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TableRow.Cells%2A> collection is a collection of <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TableCell> objects that represent the cells in the row.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TableHeaderRow> inherits properties from <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TableRow> that allow you to control how the contents in the row are displayed. For example, you can use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TableRow.HorizontalAlign%2A> and <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TableRow.VerticalAlign%2A> properties to specify the alignment of the contents.
